Events that occurred on 12 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 84.
1944 – J.R.R. Tolkien sends Leaf by Niggle to the Dublin Review, which hosts a short-story competition. It was published in the January 1945 issue.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 172.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Kenneth I. Rasmussen, Jr..
1972 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rayner Unwin.
1979 - The Jackanory episode "The Last Stage" is aired on the BBC.
2004 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
2007 - Ring*Con 2007 in Fulda, Germany.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor meets Voronwë who agrees to show Tuor the way to Gondolin. The pair set out on their journey.
T.A. 3018:
With Frodo severely wounded, Strider and the four hobbits travel slowly towards Rivendell.
Gandalf hurries towards Rivendell after the Black Riders attacked him on Weathertop.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
